greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k) read by antidiagonals, in which row n lists the number of partitions of n into parts divisible by k, for k>0.
comment: Note that column k lists each partition number A000041 followed by k-1 zeros. See also A168020 and A168021.

Let T(n,k) denote the number of partitions of n into parts divisible by k. Let p(n) denote the number of partitions of n. If k is a divisor of n then T(n,k)=p(n/k) otherwise T(n,k)=0. [Conjectured by _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 25 2009] - this is trivial, just divide each part size by k - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, May 14 2010.
xref: Cf. A168020, A168021. [From _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 25 2009]
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 21 2009
ext: Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 23 2010
